title: Family of sets
summary: In set theory and related branches of mathematics, a collection F {\displaystyle F} of subsets of a given set S {\displaystyle S} is called a family of subsets of S {\displaystyle S} , or a family of sets over S . {\displaystyle S.} More generally, a collection of any sets whatsoever is called a family of sets, set family, or a set system.
